main event: On March 5, 1957, a round object the size of a dime, bright red in color, was observed with a long white trail for about 20 to 25 minutes.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 20 to 25 minutes., The object was described as round and the size of a dime., The color of the object was bright red., The object had a long white tail three times the length of its head., The conclusion suggested it was probably astronomical, possibly the Ground-Leland comet.
sighted object: one round bright red object with a long white tail
